name: Homemade Salsa Using A Molcajete
description: You might be surprised the first time you try salsa made in a molcajete.  Crushing the veggies releases additional oils and creates an explosion of flavor that traditional salsas don't have.  So good!

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse and de-stem the tomatoes.  Roast the tomatoes in the oven at 400F for 20 minutes or so.
recipeInstructions.name: Rinse and de-stem the tomatoes.  Roast the tomatoes in the oven at 400F for 20 minutes or so.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the 1/2 onion, 1/2 jalapeno, and single garlic clove.  Add these ingredients to the molcajete along with a pinch of salt.  Use the pestle to grind the ingredients together.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the 1/2 onion, 1/2 jalapeno, and single garlic clove.  Add these ingredients to the molcajete along with a pinch of salt.  Use the pestle to grind the ingredients together.

recipeInstructions.text: Once roasted, add the tomatoes to the molcajete and combine well with the other ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Once roasted, add the tomatoes to the molcajete and combine well with the other ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately and store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately and store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
